item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world." -- Voltaire

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Buddha
item.description: "Greater in battle than the man who would conquer a thousand-thousand men, is he who would conquer just one — himself. Better to conquer yourself than others. When you've trained yourself, living in constant self-control, neither a deva nor gandhabba, nor a Mara banded with Brahmas, could turn that triumph back into defeat." -- Buddha

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by George Harrison
item.description: "If you don't know where you're going, any road'll take you there" -- George Harrison

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Joan Smith
item.description: "She preferred keeping her mouth shut and appearing a fool to opening it and removing the doubt." -- Joan Smith

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "Threats are the last resort of a man with no vocabulary." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "In the case of good books, the point is not to see how many of them you can get through, but rather how many can get through to you." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Never laugh at live dragons." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Diana Wynne Jones
item.description: "I think we ought to live happily ever after." -- Diana Wynne Jones

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Elizabeth Taylor
item.description: "The problem with people who have no vices is that generally you can be pretty sure they're going to have some pretty annoying virtues." -- Elizabeth Taylor

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Great balls of fire. Don't bother me anymore, and don't call me sugar." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Anon, who wrote so many poems without signing them, was often a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Ovid
item.description: "Chance is always powerful. Let your hook be always cast; in the pool where you least expect it, there will be a fish." -- Ovid

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Robert Bloch
item.description: "Despite my ghoulish reputation, I really have the heart of a small boy. I keep it in a jar on my desk." -- Robert Bloch

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Zooey Deschanel
item.description: "I might as well just call you “Bridge to Terabithia” since you make children cry!" -- Zooey Deschanel

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Resist much, obey little." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by George Mann
item.description: "Steampunk is...a joyous fantasy of the past, allowing us to revel in a nostalgia for what never was. It is a literary playground for adventure, spectacle, drama, escapism and exploration. But most of all it is fun!" -- George Mann

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Nietzsche Friedrich Wilhelm
item.description: "Of all the evil I deem you capable. Therefore I want the good from you. Verily I have often laughed at weaklings who thought themselves good because they had no claws." -- Nietzsche Friedrich Wilhelm

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Jenny Holzer
item.description: "Savor kindness because cruelty is always possible later." -- Jenny Holzer

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "I am free of all prejudice. I hate everyone equally. " -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Susan Ee
item.description:
"Why were the other angels attacking you?"
"It's impolite to ask the victim of violence what they did to be attacked." -- Susan Ee

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "You know it’s going to be Mary the Maid, or someone like her, and there’s going to be two men and she will end up with the nice one, and there has to be misunderstandings, and they never do anything more than kiss and it’s absolutely guaranteed that, for example, an exciting civil war or an invasion by trolls or even a scene with any cooking in it is not going to happen. The best you can expect is a thunderstorm." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "I have lost friends, some by death...others by sheer inability to cross the street." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "All extremes of feeling are allied with madness." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description:
"I-I’m not making advances,” she told him as she flattened herself against his chest. “You’re just an available s-source of heat.”
“So you say,” St. Vincent replied lazily, tucking the quilt more tightly around them both.
“However, during the past quarter hour you’ve been fondling parts of my anatomy that no one’s ever dared to touch before.”
“I v-very much doubt that.” She burrowed even further into the depths of his coat, and added in a muffled voice, “You’ve probably been h-handled more than a hamper at Fortnum and Mason." -- Lisa Kleypas

item.title: Kagama-the Literaturevixen add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description: "I’ve never had any objection to appearing depraved or villainous. But I draw the line at looking like a prize idiot." -- Lisa Kleypas
